page.title: 10HIGH HOUSE FARM: UPMINSTER
page.content: {High House Farm}is situated in Upminster,approximately eighteen miles from the centre of London and is an intensive{market garden}of twenty acres.Like most market gardens of the area,it farms two types of soil,early light sandy and medium to heavy clay. On the early soil"snatch"or quick crops are grown.These include Spring/ Summer crops such as radishes, spring onions,parsley,spinach,and lettuce in peat blocks.Three of these crops per year may be harvested. Winter crops like leeks,and cabbage are generally on the clays whilst root crops such as beetroot are grown in rotation with the lettuce. As a Commission Agent Mr.Turner the owner supplies London's Covent Garden and other local shops and markets up to 5 times per week.
